definitions.definition: a thick, clear, liquid substance, especially one used on the hair or body:
to change from a liquid into a thick, soft solid
If an idea or situation gels, it starts to become more clear and fixed:
examples: They talked a lot about opening a restaurant, but their plans never gelled.

definitions.definition: If two or more people gel, they form a good relationship or become friends:
examples: The team really gelled during the first few games of the season.
